001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.conversion;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonToken;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonDeserializer;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException;
009import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
010import org.bitcoinj.core.ProtocolException;
011
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
014
015/**
016 * Deserializes a hex string as a Bitcoin {@link Block}
017 */
018public class BlockHexDeserializer extends JsonDeserializer<Block> {
019
020    public BlockHexDeserializer() {
021    }
022    @Override
023    public Block deserialize(JsonParser p, DeserializationContext ctxt) throws IOException, JsonProcessingException {
024        JsonToken token = p.getCurrentToken();
025        switch (token) {
026            case VALUE_STRING:
027                try {
028                    byte[] payload = HexUtil.hexStringToByteArray(p.getValueAsString()); // convert  to hex
029                    return Block.read(ByteBuffer.wrap(payload));
030                } catch (ProtocolException e) {
031                    throw new InvalidFormatException(p, "Invalid Block", p.getValueAsString(), Block.class);
032                }
033            default:
034                return (Block) ctxt.handleUnexpectedToken(Block.class, p);
035        }
036    }
037}
